It is difficult to answer a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions will not apply to your experiences while others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. The attempt to answer all of them is not sufficient; simply answer those which you can.

If there is any particular event or description which you feel should be included in this questionnaire, please describe it.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Days Past," will be sent to you. Research Saskatchewan Pioneer History is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 2, entitled "Pioneer Days Past," will be sent to you.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaires to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
